description.narrative: The Pacific Regional Agricultural Market Access (PRAMA) forms part of AusAID's commitment to the Food Security Through Rural Development initiative and will assist Pacific Island countries to achieve Millennium Development Goal 1, Reduce Poverty. The program will provide a mechanism to assist with facilitating export market opportunities for horticultural and other agricultural commodities. It will assist Pacific Island countries to meet import quarantine requirements of key trading partners to facilitate improved rural livelihoods through functioning markets. It will assist to identify and prioritise products to target, facilitate the development of information for and progression of market access submissions, ensure their follow up through the approval systems of importing countries regulatory agencies, and facilitate the implementation of necessary processes in exporting country government agencies. The total value of this multi-country initiative is $31.5 million over 8 years, star
